tasks.task: Driving a John Deere 8R-70 tractor to apply fertilizer.
subtasks: Sit in the driver's seat of the tractor.
Start the tractor's engine.
Shift gears to move the tractor forward.
Operate the fertilizer spreader attachment.
Control the speed and direction of the tractor.

tasks.task: Loading the fertilizer into the spreader.
subtasks: Approach the fertilizer bin or truck.
Lift the loader attachment to pick up the fertilizer bags.
Place the fertilizer bags into the hopper of the spreader.
Close the hopper lid and secure it.
Connect the spreader to the tractor.
Set the spreader for the appropriate setting based on the type of fertilizer.
Perform a check to ensure all connections are secure.
Position the tractor and spreader over the first row of the field.
Engage the spreader and start moving forward.
Monitor the spreader's operation to ensure even distribution.
Adjust the spreader settings or position as needed during application.
Stop the application when reaching the end of the section or turning around.
Repeat the process for adjacent rows.
Identify any leftover fertilizer that did not get spread.
Collect loose fertilizer from the ground if spreader malfunctions.
Return leftover fertilizer to the bin or appropriate storage.
Halt the tractor and disengage the spreader.
Open the hopper and remove any remaining fertilizer.
Check and clean the spreader mechanism for any clogs or debris.
Lubricate the moving parts if necessary.
Store the spreader properly when not in use.

tasks.task: Driving a John Deere 8R-70 tractor to apply fertilizer**
Loading the fertilizer into the spreader**

subtasks: Each **MAINTASK** represents a major action an operator must perform, broken down into **SUBTASKS** that specify the detailed steps involved. These tasks encompass driving, loading, applying, managing unapplied material, and cleaning equipment – essential components of precision agriculture and fertilizer application.
